newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin has left hospital, Kremlin says.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin has left hospital, Kremlin says.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin left hospital on Monday after having treatment for pneumonia and headed for an official residence outside Moscow to continue his convalescence, the Kremlin said.
"At about six o'clock (1500 GMT) the president moved from the Central Clinical Hospital," a Kremlin spokesman said by telephone.
Yeltsin's press secretary, Sergei Yastrzhembsky, told a news briefing earlier that the Kremlin leader's hospital treatment was ending on Monday.
Reporters then saw a fleet of black cars with an escort of jeeps drive down the snowy driveway of the hospital and out of the gate.

"The in-patient stage of Boris Nikolayevich's treatment for double pneumonia is finishing today and the president is transferring to the Gorky-9 residence near Moscow where his treatment will continue," Yastrzhembsky told the briefing.
Yeltsin, 65, was taken to the hospital on January 8 suffering from pneumonia, two weeks after returning to his Kremlin office following heart surgery on November 5.
